hanzi-su-wiki:
促

Значения

Побуждать, вынуждать; содействовать, способствовать, ускорять

Мнемоника

Подталкивать раба 亻 «коленом под зад» 足, заставлять работать.
purpleculture_pinyin:
cù
urgent; hurried; to urge; to promote; to urge haste; close; intimate
срочный; поспешил; чтобы призвать; продвигать; призвать к спешке; Закрыть; интимный
rtega_mnemonic:
促促RSurge, press, hurry, close
  • person 亻 running 足: he's been urged to hurry
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: Someone 亻 on your heels 足; 足 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
促进 [ cù jìn ]: to promote (an idea or cause); to advance; boost
促使 [ cù shǐ ]: to induce; to promote; to urge; to impel; to bring about; to provoke; to drive (sb to do sth); to catalyze; to actuate; to contribute to (some development)
督促 [ dū cù ]: to supervise and urge completion of a task; to urge on
促成 [ cù chéng ]: to facilitate; to effect
敦促 [ dūn cù ]: to press; to urge; to hasten
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 亻 [ rén ] man, person; people
    • 足 [ zú ] foot; to attain, to satisfy; enough
heisig_chinese_memo: You stimulate a person by giving him a kick from which he will feel the urge to run.
heisig_constituent: stimulate, person, leg, mouth, mending, mend
koohiiStory1: Mr T, ever the optimist, is trying to stimulate Capt Ahab´s wooden leg by rubbing it down. Capt Ahab normally wouldn´t let anyone do that, but he appreciates Mr T´s stimulating conversation.
koohiiStory2: You stimulate a person by giving him a kick.
jp_example_words:
促す(うながす): to urge, to press, to suggest, to demand, to stimulate, to quicken, to incite, to invite (attention to)
促進(そくしん): promotion, acceleration, encouragement, facilitation, spurring on
催促(さいそく): request, demand, claim, urge (action), press for
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A leader with one bare foot has the overwhelming urge to put a sock on it. The leader’s foot is really cold, so he really wants to cover it. The urge is overpowering.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself as this leader with one bare foot. Feel the incredible urge to cover it with something warm and fuzzy.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Finally you have to give into your urge. You put a sock (そく) on your foot. Ahh, that feels so much better. What a great thing, this sock.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Feel this sock on your foot. It feels great. Wiggle your toes around inside the sock as you think about how glad you are that you gave into that urge of yours. Note that this kanji also has the same reading as 足, so keep that in mind too!
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 捉 (とらえる、ソク схватить, поймать).
Ru_trainchinese: cù: (графема) торопить, подталкивать; (о сроке) сжатый; (книжн.) приближаться к
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man's (亻) foot (足) is pressed into action
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You stimulate a person by giving him a kick from which he will feel the urge to run.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " person " and " foot ", the original meaning is approaching and approaching. "Shuowen": "Push also. From the human, the foot sound." "Nineteen ancient poems-Dongcheng is tall and long": "The sound is so sad, the string is urgent and the column is quick."

" Promote " can mean shortness. Jinsi Ma Biao "Gift Shan Tao": "Sigh for Confucius, and mourn the fate of this year."

" Promote " also means small and narrow. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty: Biography of Li Yan": "The roads are long and barbarian, and the roads are narrow and fast."

" Promote " also means urgency and urgency. "Southern History-Xie Yu Biography": "Food has not been done, but Jingren was called by Xuan, and the Xuanxuan was promoted, and Russia went on riding in an instant.

" Promote " also refers to shortening. Jin Gehong's "Baopuzi-Guangpi": "Dachuan can't push its horizons to ameliorate the sentiment at an appropriate speed, and the Five Sacred Mountains can't cut their desires for the stern people.

" Promote " also means swift and hurry. "Han Lang Biography of the Later Han Dynasty": "The emperor scolded angrily: "The officials hold the two ends and push them down.""

" Promoting " also refers to pushing and urging. "Book of Jin-Xuan Di Ji": "There was a gap between Da and Wei Xing's prefect Shen Yi, and Liang wanted to make things happen, but Guo Mo was sent to surrender and go to Yi to leak his plan."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " person " and " foot ", the original meaning is approaching and approaching.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，「足」聲，本義為靠近、迫近。《說文》：「迫也。从人，足聲。」 《古詩十九首‧東城高且長》：「音響一何悲，絃急知柱促。」

　　「促」可表示短促。晉司馬彪〈贈山濤〉：「感彼孔聖歎，哀此年命促。」

　　「促」也表示狹小、狹窄。《後漢書‧酈炎傳》：「大道夷且長，窘路狹且促。」

　　「促」還表示急迫、緊迫。《南史‧謝裕傳》：「食未辦，而景仁為玄所召，玄性促，俄頃間騎詔續至。」

　　「促」還指縮短。晉葛洪《抱樸子‧廣譬》：「大川不能促其涯以適速濟之情，五岳不能削其峻以副陟者之欲。」

　　「促」亦表示迅速、趕快。《後漢書‧寒朗傳》：「帝怒罵曰：『吏持兩端，促提下。』」

　　「促」也指推動、催促。《晉書‧宣帝紀》：「達與魏興太守申儀有隙，亮欲促其事，乃遣郭模詐降，過儀，因漏泄其謀。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，「足」聲，本義為靠近、迫近。

從「 人 」，「 足 」聲，本義為靠近、迫近。《說文》：「迫也。从人，足聲。」 《古詩十九首‧東城高且長》：「音響一何悲，絃急知柱促。」 「 促 」可表示短促。晉司馬彪〈贈山濤〉：「感彼孔聖歎，哀此年命促。」 「 促 」也表示狹小、狹窄。《後漢書‧酈炎傳》：「大道夷且長，窘路狹且促。」 「 促 」還表示急迫、緊迫。《南史‧謝裕傳》：「食未辦，而景仁為玄所召，玄性促，俄頃間騎詔續至。」 「 促 」還指縮短。晉葛洪《抱樸子‧廣譬》：「大川不能促其涯以適速濟之情，五岳不能削其峻以副陟者之欲。」 「 促 」亦表示迅速、趕快。《後漢書‧寒朗傳》：「帝怒罵曰：『吏持兩端，促提下。』」 「 促 」也指推動、催促。《晉書‧宣帝紀》：「達與魏興太守申儀有隙，亮欲促其事，乃遣郭模詐降，過儀，因漏泄其謀。」
From the sound of " person" and " foot", the original meaning is approaching and approaching. "Shuowen": "Push also. From the human, the foot sound." "Nineteen ancient poems-Dongcheng is tall and long": "The sound is so sad, the string is urgent and the column is quick." " Promote" can mean shortness. Jinsi Ma Biao "Gift Shan Tao": "Sigh for Confucius, and mourn the fate of this year." " Promote" also means small and narrow. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty: Biography of Li Yan": "The roads are long and barbarian, and the roads are narrow and fast." " Promote" also means urgency and urgency. "Southern History-Xie Yu Biography": "Food has not been done, but Jingren was called by Xuan, and the Xuanxuan was promoted, and Russia went on riding in an instant. " Promote" also refers to shortening. Jin Gehong's "Baopuzi-Guangpi": "Dachuan can't push its horizons to ameliorate the sentiment at an appropriate speed, and the Five Sacred Mountains can't cut their desires for the stern people. " Promote" also means swift and hurry. "Han Lang Biography of the Later Han Dynasty": "The emperor scolded angrily: "The officials hold the two ends and push them down."" " Promoting" also refers to pushing and urging. "Book of Jin-Xuan Di Ji": "There was a gap between Da and Wei Xing's prefect Shen Yi, and Liang wanted to make things happen, but Guo Mo was sent to surrender and go to Yi to leak his plan."

促字的基本解释

促
cù
近，时间紧迫：促膝。促席（坐近）。急促。短促。仓促。
催，推动：促使。促进。敦促。督促。催促。

促字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cù］
［《廣韻》七玉切，入燭，清。］
“戚2”的被通假字。
(1)靠近，迫近。
(2)短促；短。
(3)缩短。
(4)指蹙，皱。
(5)狭小；狭窄。
(6)速，赶快。
(7)急；紧迫。
(8)猝。突然，骤然。
(9)窘迫。
(10)推动；催促。

促字的英文翻译

◎ 促
promote, urge

促字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　促； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页104第05
【唐韻】七玉切【集韻】【韻會】趨玉切，?音趗。迫也，近也，密也。　又局促小，貌。【李白詩】嗷嗷空城雀，身計何戚促。　又刺促。【晉書·潘岳傳】閣道謠曰：和嶠刺促不得休。【註】受役於世也。　又與趣同。

促字的源字形

促字的起名意思

意为短暂、紧急、催促。

promote

To urge, to promote: to urge. promote. urge. urge. Urge.

cù
I cù гл.
1) понуждать, теснить, заставлять, давить
促之太甚 наседать на него слишком сильно
2) торопить, подгонять, нажимать; ускорять, способствовать завершению
敦促 торопить
3) быть срочным, безотлагательным; быть сжатым (о сроке)
一月期限本已甚促 срок в один месяц и так уже крайне сжат
4) сближать вплотную, сводить вместе (рядом, в тесной близости); соприкасаться; тесный, близкий
II qú прил. пекинск.
диал. сморщенный, мятый
这块布太促了 этот кусок ткани слишком мятый
Radicals: ｲ, 足  (leader, foot)
Meaning Mnemonic
A leader with one bare foot has the overwhelming urge to put a sock on it. The leader’s foot is really cold, so he really wants to cover it. The urge is overpowering.
Imagine yourself as this leader with one bare foot. Feel the incredible urge to cover it with something warm and fuzzy.
Reading Mnemonic
Finally you have to give into your urge. You put a sock (そく) on your foot. Ahh, that feels so much better. What a great thing, this sock.
Feel this sock on your foot. It feels great. Wiggle your toes around inside the sock as you think about how glad you are that you gave into that urge of yours. Note that this kanji also has the same reading as 足, so keep that in mind too!

化 (превращаться), 口 (рот), 足 (нога)
Не путать: 捉 (とらえる、ソク схватить, поймать).
